vine.game

Class GameObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • vine.game.GameObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Component, GameEntity, MyTestObject, MyWrongTestObject, TileMap

    public abstract class GameObject
extends Object
    Base game class. Every gameplay class inherits this. Classes, that inherit this class can be displayed in the editor.
    Author:
    Steffen

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static byte ACTIVE_FLAG
      If this flag is set, the update method of this gameobject gets executed.
      static byte HIDE_FLAG
      If this flag is set, the gameobject gets not rendered.

    • Method Detail

      • enableFlags

        public final void enableFlags(byte flags)
        Parameters:
        flags - The flags that should be enabled for this gameobject.

      • disableFlags

        public final void disableFlags(byte flags)
        Sets the given flags (that is 1's in the byte) and disables them for this gameobject.
        Parameters:
        flags - The flags, that should be disabled for this gameobject.

      • hideFlag

        public final boolean hideFlag()
        Returns:
        True, if the corresponding flag is set.

      • getName

        public final String getName()
        Returns:
        The name identifier of this object. The name is the unique identifier to get a gameobject throughout the game. As said, the name has to be unique. If you try to create an object, that correspond to the name of an existing object, the instantiation fails.

      • update

        public void update(float delta)
        Parameters:
        delta - Time that passed since the last update call.

      • begin

        public void begin()

      • destroy

        public final void destroy()
        Use this method to destroy a GameObject that you don't need anymore. If you don't use it, the GameObject remains in memory, causing a memory leak.

      • onKeyEvent

        public boolean onKeyEvent(KeyEvent event)
        Parameters:
        event - the event to react to
        Returns:
        true if the event is consumned

      • onMouseButtonEvent

        public boolean onMouseButtonEvent(MouseButtonEvent keyEvent)
        Parameters:
        keyEvent - The key event reacted to
        Returns:
        true, if the event is consumed by this handler
